content: आश्रयः [आश्रि-अच्] {@--1@} A restingplace, seat, substratum; सौहृदादपृथगाश्रयामिमां <ls>U. 1. 45</ls> <ab>v. l.</ab>; so आश्रयासिद्ध <ab>q. v.</ab> below. {@--2@} That on which anything depends or rests, or with which it is closely connected. {@--3@} Recipient, receptacle, a person or thing in which any quality is present or retained &c.; तमाश्रयं दुष्प्रसहस्य तेजसः <ls>R. 3. 58.</ls> {@--4@} ({%a%}) A place of refuge, asylum; shelter; भर्ता वै ह्याश्रयः स्त्रीणां <ls>Vet.</ls>; तदहमाश्रयोन्मूलनेनैव त्वामकामां करोमि <ls>Mu. 2.</ls> ({%b%}) A dwelling, house. {@--5@} Having recourse or resort to, resort; <ab>oft.</ab> in <ab>comp.</ab> साभूद्रामाश्रया भूयः <ls>R. 12. 35</ls>; नानाश्रया प्रकृतिः &c. {@--6@} Following, practising; <ls>Ms. 2. 11.</ls> {@--7@} Choosing, taking, attaching oneself to. {@--8@} Dependence on; <ab>oft.</ab> in <ab>comp.</ab>; मम सर्वे विषयास्त्वदाश्रयाः <ls>R. 8. 69.</ls> {@--9@} Patron, supporter; विनाश्रयं न तिष्ठंति पंडिता वनिता लताः <ls>Udb.</ls> {@--10@} A prop, support; <ls>R. 9. 60.</ls> {@--11@} Help, assistance, protection. {@--12@} A quiver; बाणमाश्रयमुखात् समुद्धरन् <ls>R. 11. 26.</ls> {@--13@} Authority, sanction, warrant. {@--14@} Connection, relation, association. {@--15@} Union, attachment. {@--16@} A plea, an excuse. {@--17@} Contiguity, vicinity. {@--18@} Seeking shelter or protection with another (= संश्रय), one of the six {%gunas%}, <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--19@} An appropriate act, or one consistent with character. {@--20@} Source, origin. {@--21@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) The subject, or that to which the predicate is attached. {@--22@} (With Buddhists) The five organs of sense with {%Manas%} or mind.
